sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个动词均含有"乘，骑"之意。
means: drive ： 指乘坐在有轮子的交通工具之内，控制其行驶。
ride ： 通常指骑在车、马上行驶。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"促使，驱使"之意。
means: motivate ： 强调驱使人们采取行动的原因或动机。
drive ： 侧重外来的驱策力和内心的感情力量的驱使。

sentence.Network_en: I don't drive and the buses are quite hopeless.
sentence.Network_cn: 我不开车，公共汽车条件又太糟糕。

sentence.Network_en: There are certain things he does that drive me mad.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的某些举动让我很生气。

sentence.Network_en: The ANC is about to launch a nationwide recruitment drive.
sentence.Network_cn: 非洲国民大会打算在全国范围内发起招募运动。

means.word_mean: 驱使;迫使
驾驭;经营
其他释义

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English drīfan 'urge (a person or animal) to go forward', of Germanic origin; related to Dutch drijven and German treiben

entry.def: When you drive somewhere, you operate a car or other vehicle and control its movement and direction.

example.ex: I drove into town and went to a restaurant for dinner...
example.tran: 我驱车到市里一家餐馆就餐。

example.ex: He put the bags in the car and drove off...
example.tran: 他把袋子放进车里，然后驾车离去。

entry.def: If you drive someone somewhere, you take them there in a car or other vehicle.

example.ex: His daughter Carly drove him to the train station.
example.tran: 他女儿卡莉开车将他送到火车站。

entry.def: A drive is a journey in a car or other vehicle.

example.ex: I thought we might go for a drive on Sunday.
example.tran: 我想星期天我们可以驱车旅行。

entry.tran: (从马路通往住宅的宽阔)车道
entry.def: A drive is a wide piece of hard ground, or sometimes a private road, that leads from the road to a person's house.
If something drives a machine, it supplies the power that makes it work.

example.ex: The current flows into electric motors that drive the wheels.
example.tran: 电流流入了驱动车轮的电动机。

entry.def: Drive is the power supplied by the engine to particular wheels in a car or other vehicle to make the vehicle move.

example.ex: He put the jeep in four-wheel drive and splashed up the slope.
example.tran: 他将吉普车切换为四轮驱动模式后涉水爬上了坡。

entry.def: You use drive to refer to the mechanical part of a computer which reads the data on disks and tapes, or writes data onto them.

example.ex: ...equipment such as terminals, tape drives or printers.
example.tran: 诸如电脑终端、磁带驱动器或打印机等的设备

entry.def: If you drive something such as a nail into something else, you push it in or hammer it in using a lot of effort.

example.ex: I used a sledgehammer to drive the pegs into the ground...
example.tran: 我用一把大锤子把短桩打进地里。

example.ex: I held it still and drove in a nail.
example.tran: 我稳稳地拿着它将钉子钉了进去。

entry.def: In games such as cricket, golf, or football, if a player drives a ball somewhere, they kick or hit it there with a lot of force.

example.ex: Armstrong drove the ball into the roof of the net.
example.tran: 阿姆斯特朗将球打入球门网顶。

entry.def: In golf, a drive is the first stroke a player makes from the tee.

example.ex: Woosnam sliced his drive into the bushes.
example.tran: 伍斯纳姆的开杆球打进了灌木丛中。

entry.tran: (风、雨或雪朝某个方向)吹,卷,刮,冲
entry.def: If the wind, rain, or snow drives in a particular direction, it moves with great force in that direction.

example.ex: Rain drove against the window.
example.tran: 雨敲打着窗户。

entry.def: If you drive people or animals somewhere, you make them go to or from that place.

example.ex: The last offensive drove thousands of people into Thailand...
example.tran: 最后一次进攻将成千上万的人赶到了泰国。

example.ex: Every summer the shepherds drive the sheep up to pasture...
example.tran: 每年夏天牧羊人都将羊群赶到牧场去。

entry.def: To drive someone into a particular state or situation means to force them into that state or situation.

example.ex: The recession and hospital bills drove them into bankruptcy...
example.tran: 经济衰退和医疗账单逼得他们破产了。

example.ex: He nearly drove Elsie mad with his fussing.
example.tran: 他的小题大做简直快把埃尔茜逼疯了。

entry.tran: 驱使，迫使(某人做出极端的事情)
entry.def: The desire or feeling that drives a person to do something, especially something extreme, is the desire or feeling that causes them to do it.

example.ex: More than once, depression drove him to attempt suicide...
example.tran: 抑郁症使他不止一次地企图自杀。

example.ex: Jealousy drives people to murder...
example.tran: 嫉妒驱使人们去杀人。

entry.def: If you say that someone has drive, you mean they have energy and determination.

example.ex: John will be best remembered for his drive and enthusiasm.
example.tran: 约翰的魄力和热情最令人难忘。

entry.tran: 强烈欲望;强烈需求;本能需求
entry.def: A drive is a very strong need or desire in human beings that makes them act in particular ways.

example.ex: ...compelling, dynamic sex drives.
example.tran: 强烈而旺盛的性欲

entry.tran: (为达到某目的而进行的)努力,运动
entry.def: A drive is a special effort made by a group of people for a particular purpose.

example.ex: The ANC is about to launch a nationwide recruitment drive...
example.tran: 非洲国民大会打算在全国范围内发起招募运动。

example.ex: The Church in Haiti has played an important role in the drive towards democracy.
example.tran: 海地的教会在争取民主的运动中扮演了重要的角色。

entry.def: Drive is used in the names of some streets.

example.ex: ...23 Queen's Drive, Malvern, Worcestershire.
example.tran: 伍斯特郡,莫尔文市,女王大道 23 号

entry.def: If you ask someone what they are driving at, you are asking what they are trying to say or what they are saying indirectly.

example.ex: It was clear Cohen didn't understand what Millard was driving at.
example.tran: 看得出科恩并不明白米勒德想说什么。

means.word_mean: 1. the act of applying force to propel something;

sentences.sentence: "after reaching the desired velocity the drive is cut off"

means.word_mean: 2. a mechanism by which force or power is transmitted in a machine;

sentences.sentence: "a variable speed drive permitted operation through a range of speeds"

means.word_mean: 3. a series of actions advancing a principle or tending toward a particular end;

sentences.sentence: "they worked in the cause of world peace"
"the team was ready for a drive toward the pennant"

means.word_mean: 4. a road leading up to a private house;
5. the trait of being highly motivated;

sentences.sentence: "his drive and energy exhausted his co-workers"

means.word_mean: 6. hitting a golf ball off of a tee with a driver;

sentences.sentence: "he sliced his drive out of bounds"

means.word_mean: 7. the act of driving a herd of animals overland
8. a journey in a vehicle driven by someone else;

sentences.sentence: "he took the family for a drive in his new car"

means.word_mean: 9. a physiological state corresponding to a strong need or desire
10. (computer science) a device that writes data onto or reads data from a storage medium
11. a wide scenic road planted with trees;

sentences.sentence: "the riverside drive offers many exciting scenic views"

means.word_mean: 12. (sports) a hard straight return (as in tennis or squash)
1. operate or control a vehicle;
2. travel or be transported in a vehicle;

sentences.sentence: "We drove to the university every morning"
"They motored to London for the theater"

means.word_mean: 3. cause someone or something to move by driving;

sentences.sentence: "She drove me to school every day"
"We drove the car to the garage"

means.word_mean: 4. force into or from an action or state, either physically or metaphorically;
5. to compel or force or urge relentlessly or exert coercive pressure on, or motivate strongly;
6. cause to move back by force or influence;
7. compel somebody to do something, often against his own will or judgment;

sentences.sentence: "She finally drove him to change jobs"

means.word_mean: 8. push, propel, or press with force;
9. cause to move rapidly by striking or throwing with force;

sentences.sentence: "drive the ball far out into the field"

means.word_mean: 10. strive and make an effort to reach a goal;

sentences.sentence: "She tugged for years to make a decent living"
"We have to push a little to make the deadline!"
"She is driving away at her doctoral thesis"

means.word_mean: 11. move into a desired direction of discourse;
12. have certain properties when driven;
13. work as a driver;

sentences.sentence: "She drives for the taxi company in Newark"

means.word_mean: 14. move by being propelled by a force;
15. urge forward;
16. proceed along in a vehicle;
17. strike with a driver, as in teeing off;
18. hit very hard and straight with the bat swinging more or less vertically;
19. excavate horizontally;
20. cause to function by supplying the force or power for or by controlling;

sentences.sentence: "this device drives the disks for the computer"

means.word_mean: 21. hunting: search for game;
22. hunting: chase from cover into more open ground;

auth_sentence.content: There's no impulse drive, no warp drive.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There's no impulse drive, no warp drive.

auth_sentence.content: Now you can only drive electric cars around it.
auth_sentence.res_content: Now you can only drive electric cars around it.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Now you can only drive electric cars around it.

auth_sentence.content: Could female cats have more of a hunting drive?
auth_sentence.res_content: Could female cats have more of a hunting drive?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Could female cats have more of a hunting drive?

stems_affixes.word_buile: driv驾驶,偏移+e→v.驾驶,开车 n.&v.驱动
driv驾驶,偏移+e→v.驾驶,开车 n.&v.驱动

Sentence.sentence: Sometimes a new technology doesn't drive the old one out, but only parts of it while forcing the rest to evolve.
The movies were widely predicted to drive live theater out of the marketplace, but they didn't, because theater turned out to have qualities movies could not reproduce
But because you can't drive a car and watch television at the same time, rush hour became radio's prime, while music, talk, and news radio greatly enlarged their audiences.
But I normally drive a Chevrolet.
The picture worsens with each round of El Nino, the unusually warm currents in the Pacific Ocean that drive up temperatures and invariably presage (预示) droughts and fires in the rain forest.
A human-shaped robot won't be stepping into your car to drive it.

means.word_mean: 驱赶
驱使, 促使

sentences.en: The ship is driven by large engines.
sentences.cn: 轮船是由大型发动机驱动的。

means.word_mean: 敲, 击

sentences.en: They drove a tunnel through the rock.
sentences.cn: 他们凿通一条穿过岩石的隧道。

means.word_mean: 驾车(尤指汽车)运送，用车送；驾车经越

sentences.en: I drove her to the airport.

means.word_mean: 驱使…拼命干，强迫…干活；迫使…行动；迫使…过分劳累

sentences.en: The boss drives his workers hard.
sentences.cn: 那位老板总是强迫他的工人们拼命工作。

means.word_mean: 强迫，迫使，逼迫，催促，使不得不

sentences.en: Her pride drove her to complete the job.
sentences.cn: 她的自尊心促使她去完成这项工作。

means.word_mean: 努力经营，促成(交易等)，使成(交)，积极进行(交易)；达成(交易，协议等)

sentences.cn: 他们做成一笔困难的生意。

means.word_mean: 消除，驱除

sentences.en: He was driven from a position of power by his political enemies.
sentences.cn: 他被他的政敌赶下了台。

means.word_mean: 私人车道

sentences.en: He'll build a drive to his house.
sentences.cn: 他将修一条直到他房子的路。

means.word_mean: 传动, 驱动

sentences.en: This car has a front-wheel drive.

means.word_mean: 紧迫, 逼迫, 压力

sentences.en: The enemy drive towards the town seemed checked.
sentences.cn: 敌人对市镇的进攻似乎已被阻止。

means.word_mean: 驾车行驶；乘车旅行；乘车，搭车

sentences.en: We usually drive to the country on Sunday.
sentences.cn: 星期天我们通常驾车到乡下。

means.word_mean: 会开汽车；开动(或操作)机动车
领到有效驾驶执照

sentences.en: You can't drive until you're 18 years old.
sentences.cn: 年满18岁才允许领驾驶执照。

means.word_mean: 驱进，被驱使；向前疾驶；猛冲；猛进，突进；飞跑；趋向；(尤指迅速)漂流

sentences.en: The computers are driving into other countries.
sentences.cn: 电脑正在迅猛地进入其他国家。

means.word_mean: (朝一目标)努力争取；瞄准；打击

sentences.en: I'm still driving away at the dictionary.
sentences.cn: 我仍在孜孜不倦地编这部词典。

means.word_mean: 努力(或奋力)地干，拼命干

sentences.en: Even after winning the game they continue to drive.
sentences.cn: 即使赢得比赛，他们还要继续拼搏。

jushi.english: I want to learn to drive next month.

jushi.chinese: 这辆车开起来得心应手。
